Returns: a printable representation of this object.
toString().Description: Returns a string containing a concise, human-readable description of this object. Subclasses are encouraged to override this method and provide an implementation that takes into account the object's type and data. The default implementation is equivalent to the following expression: See toString method.

Parameters: the protocol version of the response
the status code of the response
the reason phrase to the status code, or null
BasicStatusLine(org.apache.http.Protocol.Description: Creates a new status line with the given version, status, and reason.
BasicStatusLine(org.apache.http.Protocol.FullName: public BasicStatusLine (ProtocolVersion version, int statusCode, String reasonPhrase)

clone().Description: Creates and returns a copy of this Object. The default implementation returns a so-called "shallow" copy: It creates a new instance of the same class and then copies the field values (including object references) from this instance to the new instance. A "deep" copy, in contrast, would also recursively clone nested objects. A subclass that needs to implement this kind of cloning should call super.clone() to create the new instance and then create deep copies of the nested, mutable objects.
